meanings.definition: Boast or brag about one's own achievements or possessions.
meanings.sent1: She was always vaunting her new car to everyone she met.
meanings.sent2: He couldn't stop vaunting about his high score in the game.
meanings.sent3: The peacock was vaunting its colorful feathers to attract a mate.
meanings.sent4: The politician was vaunting his accomplishments to win over voters.
meanings.sent5: The knight vaunted his bravery before heading into battle.

meanings.definition: Display or show off in a boastful manner.
meanings.sent1: The wealthy socialite loved vaunting her expensive jewelry at events.
meanings.sent2: The pop star vaunted her latest music video during the interview.
meanings.sent3: The magician vaunted his skills by performing an elaborate trick.
meanings.sent4: The peacock vaunted its vibrant plumage to impress the other birds.
meanings.sent5: The athlete vaunted his trophy collection in the display case.
